result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from 10/3/22 Motion Hearing. DE's Exhibit #1 - DVD. Stored in Clerk of Court's office on criminal shelf. kma

3:45 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Ryan Daniel Platson in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Ryan Daniel Platson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin with Officer Luke Radke. Includes 22CF307 & 22TR1330. Court reviews file and Motion to Suppress Reasonable Suspicion filed by Atty Harrelson.  S/T of Officer Luke Radke of City of Hudson. Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty Harrelson.  DE's Exhibit 1- CD- O/R.  Redirect by ADA Becker.  Recross by Atty Harrelson.  ADA Becker makes argument. Atty Harrelson makes argument. Court makes statements and findings, Court denies Motion to Suppress and schedules this matter out to allow time for drug panel to come back. Bond continues.  Off record DE verified address and phone number. Adjourned at 4:31 PM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan Daniel Platson in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Ryan Daniel Platson.  Includes 22CF307 & 22TR1330.  Court reviews file and Motions filed by Atty Harrelson.  Atty Harrelson states they are still waiting for lab results.  ADA Becker states lab is roughly out 8 to 9 months.  Court will schedule MH.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:04 PM. bph
Motion hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Motion hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Statements and Evidence. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km              to kap
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF307 & 22TR1330:
Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA:  Michael Becker  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Ryan Daniel Platson appeared. Case called at 2:59 p.m. Court notes 22CF307 is scheduled for arraignment.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Harrelson waives further reading. Enters NG plea. Reserves on jurisdictional objections. Waives speedy trial. ADA Becker states discovery has been provided. State to provide discovery including any audio and video recordings within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing. Atty Harrelson states there may be a delay due to lab results. Court schedules. Address and phone confirmed. Court adjourned at 3:03 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Arraignment on June 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

08:07 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Ryan Daniel Platson appeared. Includes 22CF307 PH and 22TR1330 PTC. ADA Becker calls Officer Luke Radke of Hudson PD. S/T Officer Radke. Direct by ADA Becker. Officer identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Becker. Recross by Atty Harrelson. Cross by Court. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets Arraignment in 22CF307 and Pretrial Conference in 22TR1330. Defendant confirms address and phone number. Bond continues. Adjourned at 8:28 AM.  gll  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
By self - 22R 006530. jaf
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 08:00 am.

- DE to post $200.00 to be released and remaining $200.00 by May 27, 2022.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF307 & 22TR1330 (INIT):
Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Ryan Daniel Platson appeared from jail. DE qualifies for PD services. Address and DOB confirmed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court enters a NG plea on 22TR1330.
